Reviews.Title: “Extra friendly staff, decent price, good location, okay breakfast, & small pool.”
Reviews.Author: jandacut
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of high school students at a large conference in Indianapolis. The hotel was full of other high school groups at the same conference. Cam was staffing the front desk most of the afternoons and nights we were there. She was such a fun and enjoyable young lady for the students and adults that were there. She made this stay so much better! The breakfast was okay, the pool was small, but the location was very good since it was close to major streets and highways. Rooms were adequate and clean, but nothing extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Old But Remodeled and Clean”
Reviews.Author: mbeebe
Reviews.Content: Our first impression was not great but the gentleman at the desk was very nice and friendly. The hallway left a lot to be desired looking at the doors to other rooms but upon entering our room it was quite nice. All paint looked new, no gaps between counter and walls in bathroom and furniture was just fine. The area around the motel was not wonderful but if I had to, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: nicolls009
Reviews.Content: My stay at the quality inn was a great experience, the gm was excellent and a friendly guy and was very helpful to me in all the ways, i would recommend this hotel &is a great stay, i have stayed in many hotels but this hotel was a great experience there are many hotels to stay but i picked this hotel becuse from my check in & check out the front desk were so kind to me, my stay was really pleasant & i will be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JasonC50
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was having second thoughts about staying here, but everything was fantastic at this hotel, great indoor pool and fitness centre. Rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Older, dumpy motel”
Reviews.Author: jjctraveler
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn is an older motel past its prime. It looks very well worn. Wireless internet worked good, but the cable TV only had 24 channels and many were fuzzy. The window in my room did not close properly so you could hear highway noise, and the air conditioning worked, but was noisy. The floor was uneven and had squeaks in it. No fire sprinklers, but it did have smoke detectors. The bathroom has a very large counter and was bigger than in most hotels. The bed was older, but I slept well. There is a Subway restaurant attached to the hotel and an Arby’s across the street. Interstate access is excellent to I-70. The hotel really needs a gut rehab, but it will do for a quick nights stay. Checkin was quick and easy. Breakfast was acceptable with cereal, toast, fruit and waffles you can make yourself. The pool was clean. I paid $65 with tax, which seemed high for what you get. I’m not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever, Most Rude, Except for Alberta”
Reviews.Author: SccrTvlr
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had - and I have travelled extensively over the past 10 years. Facility: The neighborhood is questionable. There were holes in the walls. The side doors remained unlocked throughout the night. Every door in the place did not fit the dooframe properly. The rooms are old and worn. The fixtures were old and rusty. The water tastes bad. There were no safety or fire exit information in the rooms. The TVs did not work at all. Most of the other people we were with made the same comment. All TVs had blurry pictures. The breakfast area was crowded and made it difficult just to even get a cup of coffee. The only pro on the rooms was that the mattresses were new and I saw no bugs. Staff: The manager Eldon was extremely rude. He does not seem to understand the concept of customer orientation.His going-in position is that you are lying and wrong and there is nothing he can do. And he acts accordingly. Our toilet overflowed in the evening and so the night manager Alberta gave us a suite (the suites are nicer, but not by much). Alberta was very nice. Too bad Eldon gave her a hard time about her decision to move us to a suite. But it was the facility's only saving grace. We overpaid because we were with a group with a set rate. Eldon tried to charge us extra for having 2 children in the room with us. This hotel was not worth the $99/night we paid nor the advertised price of $68/night. I would not recommend this hotel. I heard rumor that they are knocking it down and building something else. I'm not sure the neighborhood can sustain anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere - No housekeeping service provided after 2nd night”
Reviews.Author: pkeese
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Friday evening; on Sunday, I left my room shortly after 12noon and was gone until shortly after 6pm. I came back to find that my room had not been serviced in any way by Housekeeping. I had removed the Do-Not-Disturb sign when I left the room shortly after 12noon. I immediately called the Front Desk and informed the clerk on duty of the situation, who said she would pass along the information to the 3p-11p clerk, as I had requested some type of compensation. No one ever contacted me prior to my departure. Wrote letter to GM; he responded to say that Housekeeping Attendant had indicated "DND sign left on door", so room was never serviced, which was incorrect. I was only offered a simple apology form letter from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for $60”
Reviews.Author: kaitimae
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I wonder if some of these people writing reviews expected the Ritz Carlton or Conrad. I really didn't think it was that bad for $60. We stayed here as a last-minute decision and got what we paid for, a bed to sleep in and a quick breakfast in the morning. Our room was clean, you can tell they washed the sheets and vacuumed. The entire building doesn't smell very good, but I think it's because they allow smoking in some rooms. The toliet in our room kept running because the chain was too short... my husband just happens to be Mr. Fix-it so that wasn't really a big deal. We had a fabulous view of the satellite dish and air conditioning unit out our window. That actually made us laugh... why put a window there? It can be loud if there's a lot of traffic, it's not far from busy Shadeland Ave. They serve coffee, OJ, milk, donuts and bagels with cream cheese in the morning so you can grab a bite to eat on your way out. The food wasn't spectacular but it was enough until lunch time. If you're on a budget and don't plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel, why not save a couple of bucks on hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked in and then checked out a half an hour later after using the phone to make a separeate reservation. The bed was like cardboard, there was a strange smell, and I think there were people living at the hotel. The internet ad was very decpetive.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: NashTraveler24
Reviews.Content: Staff was pleasant, but that was the only redeeming quality of this place. Very old and not well maintained. I wished I had chosen one of the nicer hotels within a block of this one.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever we stayed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in last June. Ramada Inn's name on the room phone and other imformation. Unporfessional hotel stuffs. Very old and dirty. We had to wore shoes all the time. The top of TV was melted. The bath room door couldn't shot complitely. No shade on one of lamps. We had 2 rooms and none of light balls were on lamps. We didn't know that till after dark and we came back from dinner. We had to turn on the TV to have a light or open the bath room door. Bathrooms were dirty enough to take a bath. If we were not driven 9 hours the day and didn't have our pet with us, we went to the other hotel. We reported the "choice", but no respond from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: tech3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada 21st for 3 nights and was (suprisingly) very satisfied with the experience. The place was clean, the towels were changed, the staff was very nice. Everything was in perfect working order and I even got a fridge and microwave (wich i did not ask for) !! As for the promotions, the subway sandwich is free if you buy one. You have to read the promotion on the website:)

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Internet Advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The advertising on the website as to the breakfast and free Subway sandwiches is downright deceiving. The 'made before your eyes breakfast' is pancakes made by you. It is a mediocre breakfast. You will NOT get buy one get one free Subway sandwiches, despite what the website says.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites East
HotelInfo.Address: 7050 East 21st Street & Shadeland Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46219
